title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement wenlansz@student.ubc.ca. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to gradecalculatorr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to gradecalculatorr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to gradecalculatorr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/gradecalculatorr", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to gradecalculatorr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to gradecalculatorr
text: Please note gradecalculatorr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

code: @Manual{,   title = {gradecalculatorr: Calculates Grades For a Course},   author = {Edward Yukun Zhang and Chen Lin and Shirley Zhang},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/yukunzGIT/gradecalculatorr}, }

title: Calculates Grades For a Course
text: R package calculates grades course. package allows users customize course information self-defined course component names, update grades different course components, even understand well final exam needs pass course achieve target final grade.

title: Calculates Grades For a Course
text: package contains following functions: construct_course: Allow users input information one course component (example, assignment name corresponding weight) one one. Saves course information .csv file specified file path. (Note: user self-defined course component name(s) can accepted) update_grades: Allow users update course component grade(s) loading certain saved course .csv file. function can save updated course information new .csv file specified file path. predict_final: Calculate well final exam order pass course achieve certain grade just final exam (scenario final grade missing), based provided course component information. calculate_grade: course components presented, calculate course overall grade based information provided.

title: Calculates Grades For a Course
text: course grade calculator unique provides interactive way users input course component information update information needed. predict_final function available, users can understand well final exam order pass course achieve certain level grade course, adjust final review plans based calculation, meet course expectation. package predict_final function take users’ previous study course information account calculation desired final performance, based current course component information inputted/updated. course grade calculators R ecosystem. similar example can found serves group students. packages focus auto-grading group students without user interaction provide similar functions like predict_final function package.

title: Calculates Grades For a Course
text: can install development version gradecalculatorr GitHub :

title: Calculates Grades For a Course
text: get started, load library: {r setup} library(gradecalculatorr) Next, let’s explore function construct_course(): {r construct course usingconstruct_course()} construct_course('dsci524','/')  #> construct_course('dsci524','/')  # name dsci524 component #1? lab1 # weight percentage dsci524 component #1? 15 # name dsci524 component #2? lab2 # weight percentage dsci524 component #2? 15 # name dsci524 component #3? lab3 # weight percentage dsci524 component #3? 15 # name dsci524 component #4? lab4 # weight percentage dsci524 component #4? 15 # name dsci524 component #5? quiz1 # weight percentage dsci524 component #5? 20 # name dsci524 component #6? quiz2 # weight percentage dsci524 component #6? 20 #  Components         Weights (%)         Grades (%) # 1       lab1                 15              <NA> # 2       lab2                 15              <NA> # 3       lab3                 15              <NA> # 4       lab4                 15              <NA> # 5      quiz1                 20              <NA> # 6      quiz2                 20              <NA> , let’s update grades: {r update grades} update_component_grade('dsci524.csv', 'lab1', 90.15) update_component_grade('dsci524.csv', 'lab2', 88.22) update_component_grade('dsci524.csv', 'lab3', 86.65) update_component_grade('dsci524.csv', 'lab4', 88.75) update_component_grade('dsci524.csv', 'quiz1', 90.15) , let’s calculate well quiz2 order get 85% total course 524: {r predict quiz2 grade} predict_final('dsci524.csv', 85) # > [1] 69.5 quiz2, know get 90 quiz2 let’s calculate overall grade course 524: {r calculate overall grade} update_component_grade('dsci524.csv', 'quiz2', 90.25) calculate_grade('dsci524.csv') # > [1] "Course grade 89.15%"

what:
Allow user to input course components' information
(component name and coresponding weight) one by one.
Course components could be the following for example:
1. Assignment(s)
2. Quiz(s)
3. Lab(s)
4. Midterm(s)
5. Final(s)
6. Any user self-defined course component name(s) — construct_course
